description:
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

About the opportunity:

Frontiers catalog is growing. Every month we need to handle more journals, articles, and research topics, to process more data and enable new features for our users.

We are looking for a Data Scientist (Graph) Team Lead with experience leading teams, to join our business and manage a Data Team formed by Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

You will define, plan and coordinate internal technical projects related to our Data Products. The development and evolution of knowledge graphs, and the creation of a solid data foundation to empower our data scientists and our machine learning team.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, coach and evolve your team, creating a culture of excellence that will allow them professional growth.
Plan and coordinate the activities for the creation of data products and features that extract value from data in our different systems.
Lead the work in a complex data-intensive environment, handle the integration with systems built by other teams.
Map business and technical requirements into actionable initiatives, reporting and analyzing results in a timely manner, and learning from any mistakes
Work close to the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team, to help them to extract the maximum value and empower their initiatives.
Collaborate with other leaders to identify and capitalize on opportunities to leverage new technologies and create novel solutions to our organizations challenges.

What we are looking for:
Minimum 5 years experience as a Senior Data Scientist or Senior Data Engineer with at least 3 years leading teams
A natural leader, proactive and hands-on
Comfortable handling uncertainty in evolving scenarios who can understand priorities and balance them
Strong knowledge of current industry-wide Data Engineering and DS/ML practices, tools, and techniques
Our technical stack is based on GCP, Google BigQuery, Kafka, Databricks, PySpark, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch and therefore knowledge on any of these would be highly beneficial
These are some of the data challenges we are working on and therefore any experience with these would be beneficial:
Knowledge of Neo4j
Knowledge of Cypher queries
Experience working with knowledge graph
Familiarity with Agile framework
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

job_title: Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics - Home based - EUROPE
description:
Description

Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics

Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives.

Our Clinical Development model brings the customer and the patient to the center of everything that we do. We are continuously looking for ways to simplify and streamline our work to not only make Syneos Health easier to work with, but to make us easier to work for.

Whether you join us in a Functional Service Provider partnership or a Full-Service environment, you’ll collaborate with passionate problem solvers, innovating as a team to help our customers achieve their goals. We are agile and driven to accelerate the delivery of therapies, because we are passionate to change lives.

Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know:

WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE

Why Syneos Health
We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.
Job Responsibilities
Plans, organizes, manages and monitors the sector’s activities/operations according to his/her field of expertise, strategic and tactical alignments, and the needs of the organization in order to achieve the expected results.
Manages all operations activities related to the Pharmacometrics sector.
Provides quotes for all services provided by the team (e.g., Pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamics analyses, toxicokinetics analyses, additional analyses not included in the original scope of work, etc.)
Provides other consultation services in clinical pharmacology field.
Acts as a pharmacometrician.
Acts as a scientific consultant/clinical pharmacologist for clients, proposing methodologies or performing pharmacometrics analyses (e.g., PK/PD analyses).
Ensure proper training and development of pharmacokineticists and pharmacometricians.
Review/prepare pharmacometric section of study protocols and/or Pharmacometric analysis plans for preclinical or Phase I to IV studies.
Manages human capital including workforce planning and hiring activities, performance management and the daily monitoring of productivity; facilitates knowledge development and transfer; and ensures the efficiency and mobilization of the team in order to achieve the expected results.
Helps develop and analyze the sector’s performance indicator systems according to the established objectives. Identifies opportunities to improve the division and/or service’s master plan and processes. Determines, as needed, the necessary actions in order to increase efficiency.
Contributes to the development of the sector’s budget, ensures that it is being adhered to, performs budget follow-up for pertinent stakeholders and recommends actions in an effort to achieve the expected results.
Communicates the necessary information to keep the team, the organization, and external clients abreast of the sector’s work plan, policies, projects processes, results, and actions and recommendations taken to meet arising needs and to achieve the expected results.
Advises internal/external clients of the division and/or service’s particular areas of expertise by assessing needs, and carrying out analysis and follow-up.
Acts as a consultant and resource person for external clients and Business Development employees with respect to pharmacometric issues.
Acts as a clinical Pharmacologist.
Represents the sector, both internally and externally, as a source for consultation and/or information and/or reference.
Promotes clinical pharmacology services.
Fosters the company’s scientific outreach by attending seminars, writing scientific articles, participating in conventions, interacting with the academic community, etc.
The employee may be called upon to perform other tasks related to their skill set, and for which he/she has been trained.
Qualifications

What we’re looking for
MSc or PhD in Biopharmaceutical Sciences, Pharmacology, Experimental Medicine or in another relevant field.
Word, Excel, and software used in pharmacometrics analyses: WinNonlin, SAS, NONMEM, etc.
Required bilingualism includes communicating verbally and in writing on topics that are often technical, and writing procedures or technical reports.
Candidate who does not possess the required training and/or experience may be considered under different criteria.
Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health

Additional Information

Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

Sales Engineer Life Science
Location: Sweden - Fully Remote
Patch: Sweden - National
Salary: Competitive Basic + Bonus + Car + Corporate Package (27 days holiday, Enhanced Carer/Paternity Leave, Additional Holiday, EAP and more)
Markets: Bioprocess, Life Sciences / End Users, OEMs
Products: Full solutions across Fluid Handling, Pumps, Hoses, Capital Equipment

Watson Marlow Fluid Technology Solutions is an SSE PLC Group company (https://www.spiraxsarcoengineering.com/) - SSE (London Stock Exchange - FTSE 50) is a manufacturer of engineered solutions, employing 8500 people across 130+ operating units globally.

Are you an experienced field sales professional with knowledge of the process market? Want to be part of a fast-growing FTSE 50 engineering OEM working with the cutting-edge industries in the process market.

We now have a vacancy to join our dynamic and successful Nordics sales team. You will be tasked with supporting our growing customer base across Sweden. This region has full local back office support including a team of sales support and applications engineers; it's well established with a network of valued customers.

Fully training is provided so previous experience in our niche markets is not required; however, due to the technical nature of our customers a good grasp of fluid handling or process machinery is essential - this could be from any mechanically engineered product background (compressors, instrumentation, valves, capital equipment etc), or scientific background (consumables, process capital equipment, medical devices etc).

This role sits in our Nordics sales team reporting to the Sweden based Sales Manager.

This role will focus on:
Prospecting for new business with target customers promoting the full range of our products where appropriate maintaining a database of targets and a development plan for key targets.
To develop and maintain a healthy pipeline for the territory from lead generation through to closing.
Follow up all sales leads, quotations and win new business within area of responsibility.
To be part of a worldwide team in a company committed to constant improvement and change which requires each process to be constantly examined and developed.
Provide customer demonstrations of our products as required.
Visit exhibitions of interest as requested and man exhibition stands as required.
Live and breathe the company values of Respect, Integrity, Excellence, Customer Focus, Collaboration and Safety.

Descartes Unites the People and Technology that Move the World

The need for efficient, secure, and agile supply chains and logistics operations has become ever more critical and complex. By combining innovative technology, powerful trade intelligence and the reach of our network, Descartes helps get goods, information, transportation assets, and people where they’re needed, when they’re needed.

We’re one of the most broadly deployed logistics and supply chain technology companies in the world. More than 22,000 customers around the globe use our cloud-based solutions to transform the way they move inventory and information to enhance productivity, better serve customers, thrive competitively, keep pace with evolving regulations, and respond to rapidly changing market conditions. Descartes is publicly traded (Nasdaq:DSGX, TSX:DSG) with headquarters in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, and offices and partners around the world. With record financial performance for more than 16 years, we lead the industry in innovation investment. Every day, logistics service providers, manufacturers, retailers, distributors, and other logistics-intensive businesses of all sizes rely on our scale, stability, and comprehensive solution footprint to move what’s most important to them. Learn more at www.descartes.com.

We’re growing fast and invite you to join our amazing team.

Position Summary

Automation Engineering is a strategic function that is being added to the Descartes IT group. The IT group provide infrastructure services, and support technical operations, to ensure delivery of stable, secure and performant products to our customers. The Automation Engineering role is a transformative role within the IT department, working to apply automated solutions to infrastructure and operational challenges. As an Automation Engineer you will leverage various tools such as, PowerCLI, Ansible, Tower (AWX), SCCM, and powershell scripts to offer successful automation strategies and solutions for IT Operations globally within the Windows server realm.

Your role
You will be using Ansible playbooks, PowerCLI, PowerShell or python scripts, identify, groom, and create automation solutions within Technology Operations, such as Infrastructure as code (IaC) deployments, continuous enforcements, monitoring and infrastructure operations by working with various teams.
You will fulfil existing automation requests by using an Devops backlog.
You will document new and existing automation solutions.
You will contribute on Administration and maintenance of automation platforms such as Ansible Tower, SCCM.
About You
You have 5+ years of hands-on experience in automation and/or coding and Windows server administration.
You have proficiency in: PowerCLI, Graph API and Azure CLI, vSphere API, Ansible playbooks, PowerShell and Python.
You have experience in work management tools (Devops) and Documentation/Wikis (Sharepoint).
You have excellent communication skills; ability to collaborate with team members to find optimal automation solutions.
You have ability to engineer and propose new automation solutions.
You have a degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 3 – 5 years of relevant work experience. Microsoft certifications are considered a plus
You have experience in any of the following, or similar, is a plus:
Develop custom Ansible modules
VMware vSAN
Experience using APIs
Experience with SCCM orchestration
Foundation knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure)
You are self-motivated, innovative, and analytical with strong attention to detail and the ability to think laterally for problem solving.
LANGUAGES
Excellent knowledge of English (speaking, reading, and writing)
LOCATION
Remote work due to the COVID-19 pandemic
Descartes office in Zilina, Slovakia.
Join Us

As we scale, we’re looking for new doers, collaborators and innovators to join Descartes in uniting the people and technology that move the world as the Global Leader in Logistics and Supply Chain Technology. We’re entrepreneurial, hardworking, geeky-in-a-good way problem solvers. Guided by our values, we nurture a TEAM focused culture that invests in people and creates opportunities for advancement across a broad spectrum of career paths. We prioritize work-life balance and foster an environment with the space to take ownership, to be heard, and to carve a path for your individual accomplishments to help drive our success. At Descartes, everyone has a voice and the best argument wins, regardless of who makes it. We offer competitive compensation, great benefits, remote and flexible work hours, and the opportunity to join a company on an awesome mission with a great existing team and trajectory.

Descartes also has a deep sense of environmental responsibility. Learn more about how we helped our customers save over 552,000 metric tons of CO2 in 2020 by reducing fuel and paper consumption: https://www.descartes.com/who-we-are/social-responsibility-sustainability/environmental-impact .  Join a team that’s committed to working with customers to conserve resources and enhance sustainability.

At Descartes, everyone has a voice and the best argument wins, regardless of who makes it. We offer competitive compensation, great benefits, remote and flexible work hours, and the opportunity to join a company on an awesome mission with a great existing team and trajectory. If you feel you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, and Descartes sounds like the team and the mission you want to be part of, apply now. We can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider your experience.

Due to COVID-19, we've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video (Microsoft TEAMS) and are on-boarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together.

We are an Equal Employment employer. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law. For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity, please review our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics at Descartes.com .

job_title: Software Engineer Back - Java - Spring Full Remote H/F

description:
Who is Forcepoint?

Forcepoint simplifies security for global businesses and governments. Forcepoint’s all-in-one, truly cloud-native platform makes it easy to adopt Zero Trust and prevent the theft or loss of sensitive data and intellectual property no matter where people are working. 20+ years in business. 2.7k employees. 150 countries. 11k+ customers. 300+ patents. If our mission excites you, you’re in the right place; we want you to bring your own energy to help us create a safer world. All we’re missing is you!

About The Role

Forcepoint has a fantastic opportunity to join our team in Poland. This is a pre-sales engineering position where you will be working extremely closely with sales. You will be aligned with a sales rep and carry a joint quota. You are expected to work as team to create and execute a territory / account plan. This includes building relationships with partners and ensuring they can position and implement our solutions.

From a technology perspective we are looking for someone with a Web, DLP and NGFW security background, with experience on positioning security products on large customers. You will be joining a great, successful team of SEs who will be happy to bring you up to speed. While we are responsible and accountable for our patch – we support and help each other, and only good team players will succeed.

Like the industry and our customers, we are transitioning from network and data security products to a “Data-First” SASE architecture. Not all companies are moving at the same speed and many continue with our really good NGFW, DLP, Web Security and other products. You should feel at home in both worlds.

What you will be doing:

Lead discussions with customers to drive understanding and documentation of the customer’s environment and needs, specifically their cross domain, network security, DLP/Intellectual property protection needs and recommend appropriate products/services that meet these needs.
Deliver product, technology and/or customized solution presentations to technical and business decision makers which may include system demonstrations, white-boarding and technical Q&A sessions to the client.
Provide pre-sales technical support, security engineering and technical guidance for the development and implementation of Forcepoint cybersecurity technologies for customer.
Work with customer, strategic partners, resellers and Forcepoint team members to architect, design, build, and deploy cyber security solutions for customers and partners in support of pilot and proof of concept demonstrations.
Attend industry conferences, trade shows and sales events and participate in related activities.
Prepare, write, and present trade studies, cost benefit analyses, white papers, reports and briefings as required.
Work with account managers and proposal team to develop technical content and diagrams for RFI/RFP responses
Orchestrate Product Specialists involvement during pre-sales activities
Collaborate with partners and professional services to design projects activities in order to have them aligned with customer expectations
Assist with maintaining state of the art demonstration and lab capabilities and other duties and projects as assigned.

What you can bring:

BS Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security or equivalent degree or equivalent experience
A minimum of 6 years demonstrated experience in cyber security field to include practices/methodologies, associated technologies, application design, and/or experience in an operational environment
3 years of pre-sales experience working directly with cyber security and/or network products in a team environment
Ability to effectively communicate with a broad range of audiences; from deeply technical to high executive C-level decision makers (sometimes in the same audience).
Must be able to collaboratively coordinate across traditional engineering disciplines, management and customers
Knowledge of networking topology, TCP/IP protocol, IP Forwarding, Network architectures, and components (firewalls, routers, etc.)
Linux/Windows systems administration experience preferred
Relevant industry certification programs (e.g. CISSP [and specializations], Certified Ethical Hacker, Carnegie Mellon Insider Threat Program Manager, Insider Threat Vulnerability Assessor, Insider Threat Program Evaluator, etc.) desired, but not required
Experience with cyber security engineering projects and programs
Pre-sales experience working directly with cyber security and/or network products in a team environment.
Experience with Web security
Experience with Data Loss Prevention projects, approach and logics
Ideally have experience working with enterprise accounts
Confident communicator, able to proactively engage with customer.
Strong understanding of customers and prospects requirements, security design and system architectures

How You Will Work

Remote
Flexible working hours

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Why Forcepoint?

We foster a human-centric culture, both inside and out of Forcepoint’s walls: accepting, welcoming, and embracing the individuality that makes us each tick – while recognizing it’s our collective spirit that makes us who we are. We are committed to taking the necessary steps to create a culture more attuned and inclusive of the passions, perspectives, and potentials of all. Follow #WeAreForcepoint on LinkedIn & Twitter to see us in action.

You will enjoy

a flexible work environment
inclusive benefits offerings
the pace of a startup with enterprise muscle

Don’t meet every single qualification? Studies show people are hesitant to apply if they don’t meet all requirements listed in a job posting. Forcepoint is focused on building an inclusive and diverse workplace – so if there is something slightly different about your previous experience, but it otherwise aligns and you’re excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. You could be a great candidate for this or other roles on our team.

Forcepoint is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by sending an email to HumanResources@forcepoint.com

Applicants must have the right to work in the location to which you have applied.

job_title: Senior Statistical R/R-Shiny Programmer - Fast Progression– Remote – Fully Remote
description:
SENIOR STATISTICAL R/R-SHINY PROGRAMMER- Team Environment – Remote – Fully Remote

As we approach the end of 2022, many of us will question our careers and begin looking for new opportunities. But did you know statistically that most job applications are sent on Christmas and New Year's Day.

With the increased number of applicants looking, that means increased competition, reducing your opportunity to land the perfect role.

Why not beat the rush and get in touch today?

Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.

The Senior Statistical R/R-Shiny Programmer provides technical expertise for the conduct of clinical trials, acts as an internal subject matter expert in specific areas providing technical support and expert advice, and works independently to support various programing activities related to the analysis and reporting of clinical study data. Specifically, the Senior Statistical R/R-Shiny Programmer will be used to build tools to support the operational key indicators/milestones for studies/programs or to support TLF macro development. Programmer will liaise with sponsors, Biostatistics Leads, Data Management Leads, and other functional areas as required. Further, the Senior Statistical Programmer will monitor quality, timelines, resource allocation, and productivity in relation to projects to which they are assigned.

Role Responsibilities:
Programming Lead contributing to global projects
Develop and maintain project timelines as well as budgets.
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and the Pharma industry

We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.

Desired Skills:
Proficiency in R/R-Shiny (2+ years in real-world application).
Candidate must have worked in a highly regulated environment if experience is not in a CRO or Pharma
Extensive knowledge and understanding of the programming and reporting process.

Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working

Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.

Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.

Please apply below or email your CV to at Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com

Looking to make an impact? Work on a team that emphasises collaboration and innovation? At SailPoint, we believe our success is directly tied to our corporate culture. Our Core Values, affectionately also known as the “Four I’s”: Innovation, Integrity, Impact, and Individuals inform the work we do here at SailPoint. and because they are independent of scale, they have served us well from our early days as a start-up through today as the fastest-growing, independent identity and access management (IAM) provider.

Why SailPoint?
Love what you do. And love where you do it.
Smart people, fun culture, innovative work, collaborative on-site and remote environments — oh, and everyone’s really nice. That’s what people say about SailPoint. We’re known as the company where everyone wants to work.
If you’re passionate about outsmarting cybercriminals and working at a company where you can truly have an impact, we want you to join us in either Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands remotely.
SailPoint empowers the largest, most complex organisations by putting identity at the Centre of Security and IT. Our 2,000+ customers including global financial institutions, government entities, pharmaceutical organizations, and retail organizations and more.

What you’ll Do:

The Implementation Engineer (part of Professional Services) plays a vital role in the successful setup, integration, and deployment of SailPoint’s SaaS (Identity Now) service offerings. This role will be working in our German market, requiring proficiency in both English and German. Implementation Engineers begin their journey at SailPoint with product training where they can leverage their professional experience to gain a deep understanding of our SaaS (Identity Now) solution. Within a month or two, they begin serving as technical engineers on customer projects. In these projects, they will employ their industry knowledge, technical and communication skills to implement organisational best practices for SailPoint products and identity governance. Within six months, Implementation Engineers will have established themselves as technically proficient and reliable team members within Professional Services, able to handle large, complex projects under the guidance of a Solution Architect. By the end of their first year, they will have become a trusted resource capable of providing world-class service with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities:
Working with customers on the installation, integration, and deployment of SailPoint SaaS products.
Configuring SailPoint product as defined by Solution Architect.
Communicating to clients and partners aspects of both the product and the implementation at the technical and/or functional level.
Delivering technical training designed to enable/educate SailPoint customers and implementation partners.

Requirements:
3-5 years of professional work experience as part of a software company or systems integrator. This should include 2+ years of SaaS implementation experience
Excellent communication skills (German and English) and experience working with clients and partners.
Experience with some or all the following:
Angular JS, Java, Bean Shell/JavaScript, JSP/Servlets, SQL.
Web technologies: XML, SPML, SOAP, REST, Web / Application Servers, HTML.
Setting up and installing software on both Windows and Unix
RDMS Database Knowledge: Oracle, Sybase, MSSQL, MySQL.
Experience with enterprise directories such as Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP.
Networking principles: SSL/TLS/HTTPS, Certificate Management, Basic TCP/IP troubleshooting.
Familiarity with cloud technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP.

Preferred:
SailPoint or other identity governance vendors such as Microsoft, Sun, Oracle, IBM, or Novell a plus
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts a plus
Familiarity with role-based access controls and least-privileged access models a plus
Experience with project management duties (project planning, resource management, scope, schedule and status, documentation)
Experience with quality assurance duties is a plus (usability testing, performance testing, automated testing, test scripts, test cases and test plans)
Security software or IT audit experience
Other languages such as French, Spanish or Italian are desirable but not essential

Education:
Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. J2EE certification is a plus. CISSP certification is a plus.

Location:
Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands

Travel:
This position requires up to 15% travel,


SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

job_title: Software Engineer Data Presentation - Remote Germany
description:
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000+ employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.

Data visualization is often the most striking (and for some, the most accessible) part of the data-to-insights process. Let’s face it — there’s nothing more exciting than beautiful fit-for-purpose data viz.

We are looking for a talented software engineer to create usable, intuitive, beautiful interfaces and scalable engines for Dataiku DSS. Dataiku DSS brings together big data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with either user-friendly interfaces or code. The same platform also allows business analysts to create powerful machines or deep learning models with just a few clicks.

What We Do

We design and code experiences that resonate with our growing customer base. We empower non-technical users with user-friendly and well-thought tools to let them quickly and efficiently visualize, analyze, or process their data. Our current technical stack is based on Javascript, AngularJS, Angular, and D3.js on the frontend (we only support the latest versions of Chrome and Firefox!). We develop using Java, Spring, and Python on the backend.

What You Will Do

With your top-tier teammates from the engineering team and the help of the UX team, you will:

Build the components that allow Dataiku DSS users to create and display charts, dashboards, and ad-hoc web applications in a scalable way (both frontend and backend).
Prototype and create new ways to interact with data or integrations with other products such as Tableau, PowerBI, Salesforce, Slack, etc.
Work closely with product managers and UX designers to brainstorm on new features and iteratively refine solutions.
Shape a safe place to work where all ideas and suggestions are welcome and taken into account, and where we all know everyone does their best.
Write high-quality code, as your teammates do!
You are the ideal recruit if:

You have experience in software development and you are interested in data visualization tools.
You are customer-oriented — you want to understand customer needs and how the product is used.
You are at ease with both frontend and backend development, or you’ve mastered frontend development but are not afraid to dive into backend code to better understand how it works.
You know that a chart is worth a thousand grid cells.
You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) building a real product.
You blink each time you see a misaligned pixel!
You are humble and kind. You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and you treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty.
Dataiku’s culture is right for you if:

You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits
You need autonomy to thrive - we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines
You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more
You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week
You care about giving back - it’s what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing

At Brooks, new ideas, new technologies and new ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and challenge the status quo with novel thinking and collaborative work relationships.

All we accomplish is grounded in our core values of World Class, Empowered, Accountable, Respectful, Engaged.

Applications Engineer (m/f/d)

Job Description

We Are Brooks.

Brooks is a growing, fast-paced technology leader of automation solutions which boost the dynamic and expanding semiconductor and life sciences lab markets. At Brooks, innovative ideas, technologies, and ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer-focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and collaborate with one another to achieve new heights.

We are looking for our next as we accelerate our growth journey. The Applications Engineer position will be customer facing position will work closely with, and support, our OEM and end-user customers to solve their stimulating & high-value problems through the application of our automation product lines in close corporation with Product team and Engineering.

The ideal teammate will promote our growth by becoming the product use-case expert for our customers and provide their technical expertise to both customers and our regional sales staff in sponsor of Design-In Win opportunities.

What you will do:

Applications
Work alongside the sales team to determine what the customer really needs.
Be a self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and motivated by a challenge.
Have a “can-do” mentality, and willing to roll up their sleeves to help a colleague or customer.
Becoming an expert with our products’ use-cases, e.g., vacuum robots & wafer handling systems, atmospheric wafer handling systems, loadports, underlying motion controls & software, to provide pre-sales technical support to our customers and account teams.
Guiding product integrations at customer sites as well as directly working on the products for:
Demonstrating product features and performance
First Article sign-off
Product escalations
Debugging complex issues with the Field Service staff
Working objectively and as a team member to quickly respond to customer needs.
Answering questions from OEM customers about all aspects of our products
Building and maintaining relationships with customers to become their technical interface and trusted advisor .
Understanding Customers’ applications and markets
Preparing detailed product specifications to define solutions to meet customers’ high value applications.
Working with the sales, & marketing staff to identify, assess and prioritize potential customers and applications of our products.
Communicating customer needs and wishes to our marketing, & product engineering staff and launching internal projects for customer requests, leading to new Products, Product enhancements, features or software.
Supporting customer visits, attending & presenting at trade shows and seminars
Developing and delivering demonstrations to win opportunities.

What you will bring:

Technical ability to read a drawing, understand how it works, and electrical/mechanical skills.
Self-starter that is inquisitive, excellent problem-solving skills, and motivated by a challenge.
Fast learner, a great teammate, have a “can-do, no fear” mentality, and willing to roll up their sleeves to help a colleague or customer.
Experience in a customer-facing role.
Understanding of electronic components such as sensors, switches, relays, actuators, etc. Able to understand system-level wiring diagrams.
Helpful, patient and possesses the ability to relate to many types of people.
Able to work through problems systematically and document the findings.
Strong commitment to goals and team-first attitude.
Experience in 2D CAD, 3D CAD experience is a plus.
Basic Experience with scripting Languages or programming.
Able to travel internationally including USA.
Up to 50% travel; plannable.

What We Offer:

A combined environment that values continuous learning & growth, problem solving, innovation, and teamwork to achieve mutual success.
Supporting personal growth and continuous learning with internal/ external training programs and conference attendance
Motivated compensation
Flexible working
Employee Referral Program

About Avid

Avid makes technology and collaborative tools so creators can entertain, inform, educate and enlighten the world. Our customers are the visionaries behind the most inspiring feature films, television programs, news broadcasts, televised sporting events, music recording and live concerts.

To learn how Avid powers greater creators or for more information, visit www.avid.com.

Avid is looking for a talented software engineer to join the Media Composer Data Management Team.  The candidate will have an opportunity to contribute to Media Composer, Avid's flagship professional video editor.  Avid's products are used in the most recognizable films and TV shows streamed and broadcast around the world.  The Data Management Team supports the design and implementation of the rich set of metadata that follows media throughout the editing pipeline.

Responsibilities and Duties :

Design and implement high-quality software in C++
Desire to work in a multi-site distributed team using Agile/Scrum
Implement and debug all aspects of media and metadata, from persistence to user presentation, throughout the Media Composer editing experience
Program on both Windows and macOS operating systems
Design and implement automation to accompany all features
Translate requests from a scrum Product Owner into working, maintainable production code
Monitor user forums and beta feedback for a user-centric approach to software engineering

BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering or Math
5 to 7 years of professional experience

Performance optimization experience, including multithreading and strong knowledge of data structures

Background in digital media products highly desired

Experience programming on either Windows or macOS
Experience with writing robust unit tests and using test driven development is required
Desire to work in a multi-site distributed team using Agile/Scrum
Creative and innovative mindset
As the position requires frequent communication, very good English skills, both written and spoken, are a given requirement.

LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a Conversational AI company creating digital experiences that are Curiously Human. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview

The LivePerson SRE team is looking for DevOps Engineer to join our Observability Engineering team. We are looking to provide world-class and easy-to-use observability tools for our engineering and product teams. We believe that by partnering with our engineering and product teams, we can help select, build out, and release observability tooling.

You Will
Help drive the selection, testing, implementation, and rollout of new observability tooling.
Maintain existing observability infrastructure, ensuring performance, availability, and stability goals are met.
Partner with engineering and product teams to understand their current observability challenges and provide solutions.
Deploy changes to observability infrastructure leveraging IaC and configuration management tooling.
Develop and extend in-house built observability tooling.
Contribute to our 24/7 on-call rotation for observability infrastructure.
Document observability golden paths for teams to quickly adopt and maximize usage of existing monitoring tools.
You Have
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline, or in place of a 4-year degree, equivalent engineering work experience.
3+ years of experience in a DevOps or Software Engineering role.
3+ years of experience with software observability tooling
2+ years of experience in one or more programming languages
Experience with 3 or more of the following types of observability tooling: logging, metrics, events, alerts, debugging, and tracing.
Experience managing infrastructure in a hybrid cloud (on-prem & public cloud) is preferred.
Experience with Go or Node.JS is preferred.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform is a plus.
Benefits
Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: 28 vacation days
Development: Native AI learning
Additional: Food Vouchers, monthly phone and internet allowance.
Why You'll Love Working Here

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. Job Summary

A position has become vacant within our Manufacturing Engineering department for an enthusiastic and inquisitive Manufacturing Engineer SAT (Supplier Account Team). We are looking for a new colleague with experience in a low volume high complexity industrial environment and aerospace supply chain experience or a passion for it. Within this position you supervise external suppliers and assess their production documentation in order to achieve effective, efficient and correct production methods.

Job Responsibilities

Analyze product specifications and determine the production method of articles or operations manufactured externally.
Be the point of contact for all technical issues of external producers and implement changes and improvement projects in production processes;
Determine together with your colleagues from the Supplier Account Team, where the relevant articles or operations are placed.
Assess and control production documentation, production times, quality assurance and First Article Inspection documents prepared by suppliers.
Provide advice on - and supervise qualification tests and first production series.
Investigate product deviations and handle them;
Take initiatives with regard to optimizing the performance of suppliers.
Assess the technical capabilities of suppliers and support audits.

Job Qualifications

Technical Bachelor, preferably in Mechanical Engineering or Aerospace / Automotive Engineering, Master’s degree preferred;
Analytical, innovative and problem-solving ability;
Machining knowledge or experience;
Experience in heat treatment, surface treatment of metals is a plus;

We are GKN Aerospace

GKN Aerospace is the world’s leading multi-technology tier 1 aerospace supplier. With 38 manufacturing locations in 12 countries, we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers. We design and manufacture innovative smart aerospace systems and components. Our technologies are used in aircraft ranging from the most used single aisle aircraft and the largest passenger planes in the world to business jets and the world’s advanced 5th generation fighter aircraft. GKN Aerospace is a global engineering business. Every time you travel by air almost anywhere in the world, it is likely that GKN is helping you on your way. We design, manufacture and service systems and components for original equipment manufacturers around the world. We are continuously evolving, pioneering new technologies and reinventing existing ones, stretching ourselves to be better in everything we do. We are looking for people who want to make a difference, talented members with the skills and passions to become the best of the future in what they do.

What's in it for you?

Besides an innovative and international work environment that offers you a good work-life balance, we offer you opportunities to learn and grow, a competitive salary, pension plan, 27 vacation days / 13 ADV days and good travel allowance.

How To Apply

Are you interested in this position and does your background meet the requirements? Please use the ‘Apply Now’ button. Questions? Please contact our Recruiter Lucien Hermes via Lucien.Hermes@fokker.com

A balance of cultures, ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN. We need people of different backgrounds, with different skills and perspectives to spark originality, imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world.

Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do
Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who You Are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

Acreto is looking for an experienced Golang developer to join our team.

This developer will work directly with Data/Analytics branch of Acreto, for the purpose of creating scalable data pipelines that will be used for both internal and external reporting, data analysis, and eventually, ML solutions.

You will help us build our Acreto Cloud Security platform coined by Gartner as Secure Access Service Edge (SASE).

Join us! Come with us on our journey to change the face of security. We’re thrilled to work with you.

Responsibilities:
· Development of Golang-based backend system components
· Active participation in the architecture of the backend
· Participation in the Code Review process
· Creation of Automated data validation processes for the purpose of reporting
· Design and execution of pipelines into Acreto’s data warehouse for both long term and short-term analysis
· Creating indices and nodes in elastic for the purpose of time series analysis.

Must-Have Skills:
· Golang
· Elastic Cluster (7 or greater)
· DB (SQL, ORM, NOSQL)
· REST API
· Message Broker / Stream Processing: Kafka
· Microservice Architecture
· Network Protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, DNS, HTTP)
· Git Versioning, Issue Tracking, Merge/Pull Requests
· Docker
· Basic Python Knowledge
· Basic SQL Knowledge

Nice to Have:
· Design and Implementation of Distributed Systems
· Public Key Infrastructure
· IPv6 fundamentals
· VPN fundamentals
· Public Cloud Providers (AWS, GCP, …)
· Test Automation
· CI/CD workflows

How we work:
· The majority of the team works remotely, but we have offices in the US and Europe.
· We need availability during European business hours

This is a full-time, long-term position. We are NOT looking for agencies for this position.

About Acreto
End-to-end, Zero-Trust security to protect anything, anywhere. One security from one provider to protect all your systems.Acreto seeks to democratize security. We have lived in a world where security consists of stacks of bulky, inflexible solutions that do not meet the needs of all users and require huge amounts of overhead to implement and operate. In a world of increasing insecurity, and with more and more assets being moved to a digital space, one of the great challenges of our time is securing our data, our businesses, and our lives. Acreto seeks to democratize the security of our digital spaces by providing an all-inclusive, robust, and customizable SASE platform for all.Join us on our journey to provide one of the most valuable assets in an uncertain world: security. As a member of the Acreto team, you will be engaged in an environment of brilliant, motivated problem-solvers, with a passion for building a game-changing security architecture; designing elegant and intuitive User front end control; crafting robust and meaningful representations of security data; and researching cutting edge cyber-security AI.

Description de l'entreprise

Rejoindre les équipes DEVOTEAM S PLATFORM, c’est intégrer une communauté technique animée par le défi de répondre aux enjeux de nos clients en proposant des solutions innovantes. Nos équipes interviennent sur l’ensemble de la chaîne de l’API Management : l’intégration, les plateformes d’échange, le déploiement et le monitoring sur le cloud. Nous intégrons une suite complète de plateformes pour accélérer la transformation digitale de nos clients.


Description du poste

En tant que membre de l'équipe de développement, sous la responsabilité d’un chef de projet, et en étroite collaboration d’un tech lead ou d’un architecte, vous aurez les missions suivantes :

Vous analysez les expressions de besoins, rédiger les spécifications techniques et d’interfaces

Vous concevez et réalisez les flux d’intégration nécessaires pour connecter les différentes applications d’un SI

Vous participez à l’élaboration des cahiers de tests et leur exécution/automatisation

Vous participerez au déploiement des applications réalisées dans les différents environnements du client. (développement, test, recette, mise en production)





Vous souhaitez enrichir et développer vos connaissances, intégrer une équipe dynamique à l’esprit startup à Paris tout en bénéficiant d’une structure robuste et pérenne, rejoignez-nous au sein de S PLATFORM


Qualifications

Titulaire d’un BAC+5 et 1 an d’expérience de développement

Vous avez de très bonnes connaissances du cycle de développement et des rituels Agile

Vous justifiez d’une expérience réussie dans la conception et l’implémentation des solutions d’intégration

Vous connaissez les patterns des architectures d’intégration (EAI, SOA, ESB, Microservices, iPaaS)

Vous possédez un niveau d’anglais minimum B2



Votre sens du service, votre capacité d'adaptation, votre rigueur et vos

qualités relationnelles vous permettront de prendre rapidement des

responsabilités sur nos projets et d'évoluer au sein de S PLATFORM.

Vous avez une appétence technique forte et vous souhaitez diversifier vos

compétences avant une évolution vers un poste de tech lead. L’écosystème d’un SI est primordial pour vous et vous souhaitez mettre en place des solutions innovantes chez nos clients.



Vous aimez travailler de manière transverse sur de nouvelles technos,

les apprivoiser, construire autour de ces nouvelles compétences

Ce poste est fait pour vous !

Le Groupe Devoteam œuvre pour l'égalité des chances, pour la promotion de ses collaboratrices et de ses collaborateurs au mérite et lutte activement contre toute forme de discrimination. Nous sommes persuadés que la diversité contribue à la créativité, au dynamisme et à l'excellence de notre organisation. Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap


Informations supplémentaires

Toutes nos offres d'emploi sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap

Docker is a remote first company with employees across Europe and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We continued to see exponential revenue growth last year. Join us for a whale of a ride!

We are looking for a talented Solutions Engineer to join our rapidly expanding team. In this high-impact role, you will be part of a team of solution engineers that deliver outstanding results to our most important enterprise customers and our ecosystem partners by ensuring that customers successfully adopt the Docker platform and achieve their business objectives. This role reports to our Director of Solutions Engineering and works collaboratively with Sales, Customer Success, Product and Engineering teams to best serve our customers.

Responsibilities:
Work with a team of solution engineers that deliver the following:
High levels of customer satisfaction through technical reviews designed to share knowledge, known best practices for adopting Docker products, identifying and preventing issues, and ensuring that customers experience value
Discovery: Determine customer implementation needs and recommend best practices to implement Docker products
Onboarding: Assist clients with onboarding to their Docker Products leveraging best practices, and integrating with their existing infrastructure and IT practices
Assist clients with technical questions, leveraging other resources as appropriate, and escalating critical issues as appropriate
Meet virtually or in person with your customers
Advocate for product enhancements with Engineering & Product Management to solve customer challenges
Present to technical executives and directors on the Docker platform strategy, concepts, and roadmap
Coordinate critical support issues and provide context and continuity across different teams that interface with your customers
Author technical content such as white papers, knowledge base articles, architectural diagrams, or demos to leverage your field experience across customers and partners
Leverage best practices for Docker products to guide customers to a sustainable, scalable Docker environment

Qualifications:
Experience developing collateral to assist customers with best-practice adoption
Experience interfacing with internal teams, including technical support, product, and engineering, to enhance documentation, enablement, and product features to improve customer experience and enablement.
Experience in managing customer relationships at the technical and business level
Experience with virtualization and cloud services (VMWare, Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.)
Ability to solve technical problems and translate customer experience to actionable feedback for engineering
Experience in Linux and Windows Server administration
Ability to travel to customer locations
Experience with infrastructure layers such as networking, storage, security, and operating systems
Experience with DevOps concepts and tools (continuous integration and deployment, configuration management, serverless architecture, etc.)
Understanding of Docker and the container ecosystem

What to expect in the first 30 days
You will be welcomed with a first-in-class onboarding experience that includes equipment setup, a sweet swag package, and a collaborative training program
You will learn how to navigate through award-winning sales tools such as; Salesforce, Outreach, SalesForce, Looker, and Docker.
Actively engage with senior stakeholders, and manage relationships with clients
You will work closely with your peers and partner with CSMs to develop strategies to advocate for our customers.
At the end of your first month, you will have a proficient grasp of the tools and activities necessary to be successful in your role.

What to expect in the first 60 days
You will be laser-focused on supporting the CS Team during your second month.
You will have connected with all of your Team members.
You will gain in-depth knowledge of Docker’s products and how they impact our customers.
You will have an advanced understanding of tools, activities, and best practices to be successful in your role.

What to expect in the first 90 days
In month three, you will be confident in your craft and ready to immerse yourself in our customer’s business needs fully.
You will continue efforts to improve messaging, processes, and activities.
Educate our clients about our product roadmap and undertake product training for users
You will be ready to operate independently at full speed.

Perks:
Freedom & flexibility; fit your work around your life
Variety of virtual and in-person social events to build connections and have fun
Home office setup; we want you comfortable while you work
Generous maternity and parental leave
Technology stipend equivalent to $100 net/month
PTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoy
Whaleness Days: companywide day off each month
Quarterly, company-wide hackathons
Training stipend for conferences, courses and classes
Stock Options; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the company
Docker Swag
Medical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by country

Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

EU Salary Ranges

70,000 EUR - 120,000 EUR (varies based on country)

CA/NY/CO $153,000 - $230,000
salary range can change depending on the level

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do
Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who You Are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.

Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.

Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.

As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.

We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.

Planet is a global company with employees working remotely world wide and joining us from offices in San Francisco, Washington DC, Germany, and The Netherlands.

About The Role

As a security operations engineer you will play a role in all aspects of corporate security, SOC operations, incident handling, user education, and work with the application development teams during design and implementation of the system. You will help manage select critical security systems managed by the Corporate Engineering team. In the role you may also help with other corporate security related work as needs (or interest) arise. This is a hybrid role needing a range of technical and interpersonal skills.

The candidate will need a solid technical software background. This position requires working with different stakeholders, occasional code reviews, and working with developers in addressing security vulnerabilities. The candidate will have knowledge of cryptographic concepts, and be comfortable researching specific topics as needed for the task at hand. Familiarity with networking and Cloud computing systems like GCP or AWS is preferred.

Impact You’ll Own

Run, maintain, monitor, and enhance SIEM, network, server and applications monitoring
Responding to security incidents and Planet’s bug bounty program
Automate workflows and develop solutions to increase the efficiency of the team
Product security reviews
Drive processes and systems to support the success of Planet's products Core Area of Impact 1

What You Bring

Bachelor or a Master of Science degree in an Engineering discipline with a focus on Information Security
Candidates must have a computer science, software engineering, or equivalent technical background, and security concepts including cryptography
Experience developing security requirements at a cross-system level
Experience leading or participating in projects
Experience with SOC operations
Familiarity with network and application penetration testing

What Makes You Stand Out

At least 4-5 years of professional experience in a security focused role
Solid interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Experience with ELK stack
Solid development experience in Python, Go, Ruby, or equivalent in a similar language, and interested to learn other languages as needed

Benefits While Working At Planet

Additional company winter holidays and regular global days off
Remote friendly work environment and flexible working hours
Contribution to our growth by offering equity options for employees
Giving back to the community - one day per quarter for charitable work
Learning and Tuition Reimbursement
Regular hack-weeks and meetup events to exchange knowledge
Home office budget
Employee Resource Groups providing empowering spaces for connection and mentorship

Why We Care So Much About Belonging.

We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.

EEO Statement

Planet is committed to building a community where everyone belongs and we invite people from all backgrounds to apply. Planet is an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Accommodations

Planet is an inclusive community and we know that everyone has their own needs. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation during the interview process, please call Planet's front office at 669-214-9404 or contact your recruiter with your request. Your message will be confidential and we will be happy to assist you.
