At Jamf, people are at the core of everything we do. We do what’s right for our customers, our employees, our communities and our world. We take pride in simplifying technology for tens of thousands of customers around the globe and helping organizations succeed with Apple.

Jamf operates as a choice-based office model. Choose to work in the office, connect 100% remote from your home, or find the blend that works best for you.

This role is remote in the Czech Republic. We are only able to accept applications for those based in theCzech Republic or have sponsorship to live and work in the Czech Republic.

What you'll do at Jamf:

At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. You will join a unit of Cloud Engineers that contribute to Jamf Security portfolio. Some of us work from one of our offices - Brno, Emmen and London - and others are partially or fully remote. We deploy our solutions on the best cloud providers - AWS, GCP and Azure. Our infrastructure is declared with Terraform and configured with Puppet. We build and maintain over 20 K8s and K3s clusters all around the world with Rancher at the helm of it.

If Data is the new gold and you are the King of Data… what does that make you? Not sure, but you are certainly a DBA! And if you are the type of DBA that is not married to a particular technology, likes to get his hands dirty and is interested in everything related to databases then you might be what we are looking for to scale our DBA team.

What we need from you:

The DBA Team owns many core database clusters in Production as well several other instances on a wide range of technologies. You will work alongside the rest of our DBAs in a small and agile team that owns their direction of travel.

Your primary focus will be scalability, integrity, performance, availability, security, monitoring and troubleshooting of our core DB clusters, exploring new ways of consolidating data sources and making more data available to more people at Jamf and last but not least supporting our Dev Teams as they build the new features that will shape the future of Jamf.

And if you are not scared of doing some coding, you can get involved in how we build and monitor our DBs, using technologies like Terraform and Prometheus.

Some of the traits we expect from you:
No challenge is too big or too small for you. You get excited at the prospect of a complex project and at the same time you understand that small improvements can sometimes make a massive difference.
You hold yourself and your team to a high standard when working in production.
You have some cloud experience, ideally with AWS.
You have experience with at least 2 different DB technologies as well as awesome SQL skills and ideally NoSQL as well. We use Dremio, Vertica, Mongo as well as other technologies. But we won’t frown upon you if Oracle is your cup of tea.
Exposure with Big Data and column based datastore technologies will be a nice bonus point.

Why will you love it here? ❤️
Named a Fortune Best Workplace in Technology, 2022.
Open and friendly culture (yes, everybody says that, join us and see for yourself 😉).
We offer flexible work-life in a choice-based office model.
Our house is full of experienced people with passion for knowledge sharing. Check our Engineering Blog: https://medium.com/jamf-engineering out for some inspiration .
$1,000 WFH stipend to better equip your home workspace, Apple gear, and restricted stock units.
You will work on a top security product and have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact across a wide range of sectors: education, healthcare and commercial (https://www.jamf.com/resources/case-studies/ )
30 days of holiday, paid Volunteering Time Off and of course, training support and other exceptional perks and benefits.

What is a Jamf?

You go above and beyond for others, are willing to help, and support the team around you. You value and learn from different perspectives. You are curious and resourceful, a problem-solver, self-driven and constantly improving. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You are someone who cares about doing the right thing.

What does Jamf do?

Jamf extends the legendary Apple experience people enjoy in their personal lives to the workplace. We believe the experience of using a device at work or school should feel the same, and be as secure as, using a personal device. With Jamf, IT and security teams are able to confidently manage and protect Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV devices, easing the burden of updating, deploying and securing the data used by their end-users. Jamf’s purpose is to simplify work by helping organizations manage and secure an Apple experience that end-users love and organizations trust.

We are free-thinkers, can-doers and problem crushers with a passion for helping customers empower their workforce to focus on their jobs, not the hassles of managing technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We have over 2,500 employees worldwide who are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work each and every day.

Get social with us and follow the conversation at #OneJamf

Job Summary

A position has become vacant within our Manufacturing Engineering department for an enthusiastic and inquisitive Manufacturing Engineer SAT (Supplier Account Team). We are looking for a new colleague with experience in a low volume high complexity industrial environment and aerospace supply chain experience or a passion for it. Within this position you supervise external suppliers and assess their production documentation in order to achieve effective, efficient and correct production methods.

Job Responsibilities

Analyze product specifications and determine the production method of articles or operations manufactured externally.
Be the point of contact for all technical issues of external producers and implement changes and improvement projects in production processes;
Determine together with your colleagues from the Supplier Account Team, where the relevant articles or operations are placed.
Assess and control production documentation, production times, quality assurance and First Article Inspection documents prepared by suppliers.
Provide advice on - and supervise qualification tests and first production series.
Investigate product deviations and handle them;
Take initiatives with regard to optimizing the performance of suppliers.
Assess the technical capabilities of suppliers and support audits.

Job Qualifications

Technical Bachelor, preferably in Mechanical Engineering or Aerospace / Automotive Engineering, Master’s degree preferred;
Analytical, innovative and problem-solving ability;
Machining knowledge or experience;
Experience in heat treatment, surface treatment of metals is a plus;

We are GKN Aerospace

GKN Aerospace is the world’s leading multi-technology tier 1 aerospace supplier. With 38 manufacturing locations in 12 countries, we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers. We design and manufacture innovative smart aerospace systems and components. Our technologies are used in aircraft ranging from the most used single aisle aircraft and the largest passenger planes in the world to business jets and the world’s advanced 5th generation fighter aircraft. GKN Aerospace is a global engineering business. Every time you travel by air almost anywhere in the world, it is likely that GKN is helping you on your way. We design, manufacture and service systems and components for original equipment manufacturers around the world. We are continuously evolving, pioneering new technologies and reinventing existing ones, stretching ourselves to be better in everything we do. We are looking for people who want to make a difference, talented members with the skills and passions to become the best of the future in what they do.

What's in it for you?

Besides an innovative and international work environment that offers you a good work-life balance, we offer you opportunities to learn and grow, a competitive salary, pension plan, 27 vacation days / 13 ADV days and good travel allowance.

How To Apply

Are you interested in this position and does your background meet the requirements? Please use the ‘Apply Now’ button. Questions? Please contact our Recruiter Lucien Hermes via Lucien.Hermes@fokker.com

Diversity Inclusion and Belonging (DIB)

As a global engineering company, innovation is what differentiates us from our competitors and is central to our success.

A balance of cultures, ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN. We need people of different backgrounds, with different skills and perspectives to spark originality, imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world.

GKN is an equal opportunity employer.

We treat all our employees and applicants fairly and are committed to ensuring that there is no discrimination or harassment against any employee or qualified applicant on the grounds of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

For a dynamic company known for introducing high quality innovative medical devices (interventional cardiology and electrophysiology) we are looking for a National Product Specialist. Recently graduates in biomedical/engineering are very welcome!

The National Product Specialist is responsible for introducing new, innovative medical technologies to the Belgian physicians throughout the process from idea conceptualization to patient treatment. In this position, you are also responsible for product training and specialized assistance before, during and after procedure. The area to cover is a part of Flanders and a part of Wallonia.
The Hospital Representative reports to the Sales & Marketing Director.

Role & responsibilities:

Schedule appointments
Introducing and selling products

Co-responsible for a constructive cooperation with colleagues in order to achieve an optimal market penetration
Collect, interpret and channel of relevant market- and product data
Manning the stands at congresses and symposia
Participate in sales meetings
Strong planning and reporting skills

The Hospital Representative is responsible to perform the above-mentioned tasks correctly and according to the medical-ethical standards and values in order to realize the agreed targets. The Product Specialist is authorized to negotiate within the predetermined margins.

Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including:
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising
Content, offering a headless CMS
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions

Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com.

Become a Product Manager for Bloomreach Engagement! Help us create the best data experience for commerce companies on our Customer Data Engine. The work you do will impact many customers in dozens of different verticals in the e-commerce and retail space. Your work will impact hundreds of millions of customers in the online space globally. Your starting salary for Slovakia will be 3 500 - 4 700 € Gross per month, along with stock options and other benefits, depending on your experience and skills. You'll be working in one of our Central European offices (Brno, Bratislava) or from home (EU based) on a full-time basis and you´ll become a core part of the Product Team.

What challenge awaits you?

You will manage data ingestion pipelines that are crucial to enable personalized experiences for end customers. We capture tens of thousands data points in real-time each second and we import hundreds millions of rows of data every day feeding them into the rest of the product.

The data pipeline component is the core building block of our platform and enables any sort of personalized experience for end customers. It’s important you’ll understand how our customers are working with data and how it contributes to reaching their business outcomes. Without data, there is no personalization, so keeping the reliability and scalability of the solution is a must.

It’s our vision is that Data Pipeline will power all Bloomreach products and even 3rd party tools and applications connected to Bloomreach. It will be up to you to execute this vision, so that data will be available for the whole stack of commerce tools used in the customers organization.

Your job will be to:
Lead the strategy, road mapping, and prioritization for your component (Data Pipeline)
Own the the feature across the whole lifecycle, from opportunity identification, through specification & development to adoption
Discover and identify client business problems, needs, and the larger business objective
Evaluate the impact and value proposition for solving the need for the target client and find the best solution
Define and articulate what the success looks like and measure it
Coordinate and communicate with internal stakeholders (engineering, design, product marketing, product research, client-facing teams, partnership teams) from both the business & technical side.
Support the development of features from other components finding the right balance between security, compliance and ease of use.

You have the following experience and qualities:

Professional Experience
Experience in product management for a software company
Excellent fluency with data - analytical skills & the ability to use data to generate actionable insights and leverage those insights to achieve goals set for the product
Tech savviness - the ability to understand a product that is heavily built around databases and processing pipelines

Personal qualities
Adaptable and flexible - WIlling to explore new technologies, new business models, willingness to grow as a person
Determined - The ability to make difficult decisions and trade-offs and follow through
Communication skills - Motivation and willingness to handle difficult situations and being able to talk to customers, internal stakeholders and partner organizations
Independence and self-organization to navigate you through ambiguous situations, being able to prioritize the right things to work on, while juggling multiple projects in different stages of maturity

Excited? Join us and transform the future of commerce experiences.

More things you'll like about Bloomreach:

Culture:
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one.
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication.
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style.
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents.
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead.
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5

Personal Development:
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions.
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins.
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)*

Well-being:
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.*
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.*
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones.
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other.

Compensation:
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.*
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.*
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts.
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!*

(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.)

If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful!

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Description

Position at Premier Research

At Premier Research, we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We’re a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today.

We’re looking for a Data Management Reporting Programmer to join our Functional Services team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.

What You Will Be Doing
Works with cross-functional study team members in a programming capacity to create reporting solutions that support the quality and timely delivery of data management reports and visualizations required per standard and study specific data review plans
Creates, enhances, and decommissions data management reports in accordance with applicable standard operating procedures
Ensures timelines and milestones are met in collaboration with cross functional teams
Creates any needed documentation for reports and ensures proper filing
Works across the portfolio to increase automated reporting (e.g. - JReview, Spotfire) and review in order to streamline effort on data intensive studies
Enhances available reporting tools or creates new ones to support the review of clinical trial data and trial status information for cross-functional use
Provides input on data management reporting standards as required
What We Are Searching For
Bachelor’s degree, or international equivalent from an accredited institution, preferably in a programming, technical, clinical, or health-related field, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
1 to 3 years of practical experience using commercial clinical data management systems (eg – Oracle RDC / Inform, Medidata Rave, Datalabs, etc) or data visualization reporting tools (e.g. Spotfire, jReview). Alternatively, must have proven experience in all primary job functions
Practical experience with SQL or similar programming language required
Demonstrates excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in the
Microsoft Office Suite of tools (eg - Outlook, Work, Excel, etc)
Proven ability to drive a successful customer experience through positive customer interactions, provision of quality and timely deliverables, and task ownership
Strong analytical and organization skills, able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Why choose Premier Research?
Premier Research is more than a company – it’s a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need.
Our cultural anchors – Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team – mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location.
Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.
Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.

We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others.

About Us

We are a SaaS company born in Florence, Italy in 2016 with the mission of simplifying the way people ship, track and return their e-commerce orders by creating a technological layer capable of handling the complexity of Shipping & Logistics.

We are an international scale-up where people from different countries, cultures and languages work together every day to deliver innovation.

This is reflected in every product we build but also in the attention and care for the people that are working in our company.

We are currently scaling our business leveraging our technology, our team and our international culture. We are 80+ people in Europe and we have recently raised Series A funding from US investors, fueling our objectives. It is now time to grow even more and increase our talented tech team with engineers that want to contribute to the development of our products.

Who Are We Looking For

The role of the data analyst is to analyze data sets to find ways to solve problems relating to a business's customers. The expectation is that you have the knowledge and skills to turn raw data into information and insight, which can be used to make business decisions.

ShippyPro has developed the largest logistic e-commerce library online and we are looking for someone passionate about data and the insights that you can generate from it. Every hour thousands of shipments are generated on our platform and as a Data Analyst, you will be responsible to make sense of the amount of data that we collect. In this role, you will be working on internal data, for helping us drive the success of the business, as well as, building insights for our customers

What you will do:

Building and owning internal business intelligence dashboards that we use for making strategic decisions every day
Generating information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns
Analysing data to find answers to specific questions
Preparing reports for executive and project teams
Creating visualizations of data

What you will bring to the table:

You have 3+ years of documented experience in Data Analyst
Strong mathematical & numeracy skills
Strong understanding of databases of SQL Server
Good knowledge of AWS RedShift
Understanding of reporting & data visualization tools like Metabase
Understanding of ETL framework and ETL tools
Excellent analytical skills - the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data
Excellent problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail
Presentation skills – ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand
Communication skills with effective stakeholder management & conflict resolution skills

About the hiring process:

We don’t just interview candidates, we interview people.

After we receive your application, we start the screening process and if you successfully pass through this step, we will invite you to take part in some interviews.

Usually, the first one is with our Talent Acquisition Specialist to get to know each other. The following steps are more technical and they can include a business challenge.

Don't worry, we will share with you all the information you need to succeed!

What we can offer:

Our technical stack includes SQL, RedShift, and Metabase.

Remote working options. We are happy to welcome every new member into our state-of-the-art (literally!) office in Florence, however, we are also a modern and agile company, and are open to full or partial remote working where possible

No clocking in/out. We don’t believe in micromanaging and our working relationships are based on mutual trust, that’s why we don’t require our team to clock in and out of work. Of course, this trust relationship works both ways!

Work alongside an ambitious and supportive team. We are growing fast and no two days look the same at ShippyPro, but one thing never changes: your colleagues are always there to support you and to bounce off ideas!

Growth and learning opportunities. We believe that in order to grow as a company, our team also needs to continue learning and developing. Did you know that we have a growing Library in our office and you can borrow as many books as you like?

Meal pearks*: Whether you are working from home, from the office or from wherever you want, you can enjoy your meal voucher everyday. Getting hungry?

Free coffee policy. We are an international team, but our HQ is in Italy, hence we do take coffee breaks very seriously. Hot drinks are on us, and occasionally, Aperitivo too!

No dress code. That’s right, no formal attire is required when working in our HQ

only for Italian contract

We are a people-centric organization with one mission: “Make People Work Better”.

Are you determined to beat off the challenges this role brings? Send your application to join us.

WHY WERNER? BECAUSE WE ARE THE PRO'S CHOICE! You will find our market leading products and brands on trucks and job sites all over the world. Focusing on end users' needs drives our success. Our entire product development process—from research to engineering to manufacturing to commercialization—creates products that ensure ease of use, productivity, durability, and safety for the end user. On jobsites across America and the world, WernerCo brands are most preferred.

Responsibilities

Key Tasks & Responsibilities :

Implementation and development of ISO9001 system;
Design and implementation of process and system audits;
Reporting and monitoring of quality KPIs;
Active participation in the supervision of the company's documentation system;
Preparation and updating of quality management related documents;
Executing internal process & product audits, layered process audit
Active team member during failure analysis, problem solving, implementation of corrective and preventive actions to include the analysis of those effectiveness with systematic methods.
Provide quality support for manufacturing processes and projects
Active participation in the preparation of Q-Cost

Qualifications

Requirements:

MSc/BSc degree in Engineering and /or Quality

Language Data Analysts will analyze data in a given language and identify potential issues. They will also collaborate with international testing teams and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features. Data obtained will be used to train and improve speech recognition and AI systems.

Description

Position at Premier Research

At Premier Research, we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We’re a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today.

We’re looking for a Data Management Reporting Programmer to join our Functional Services team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.

What You Will Be Doing
Works with cross-functional study team members in a programming capacity to create reporting solutions that support the quality and timely delivery of data management reports and visualizations required per standard and study specific data review plans
Creates, enhances, and decommissions data management reports in accordance with applicable standard operating procedures
Ensures timelines and milestones are met in collaboration with cross functional teams
Creates any needed documentation for reports and ensures proper filing
Works across the portfolio to increase automated reporting (e.g. - JReview, Spotfire) and review in order to streamline effort on data intensive studies
Enhances available reporting tools or creates new ones to support the review of clinical trial data and trial status information for cross-functional use
Provides input on data management reporting standards as required
What We Are Searching For
Bachelor’s degree, or international equivalent from an accredited institution, preferably in a programming, technical, clinical, or health-related field, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
1 to 3 years of practical experience using commercial clinical data management systems (eg – Oracle RDC / Inform, Medidata Rave, Datalabs, etc) or data visualization reporting tools (e.g. Spotfire, jReview). Alternatively, must have proven experience in all primary job functions
Practical experience with SQL or similar programming language required
Demonstrates excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in the
Microsoft Office Suite of tools (eg - Outlook, Work, Excel, etc)
Proven ability to drive a successful customer experience through positive customer interactions, provision of quality and timely deliverables, and task ownership
Strong analytical and organization skills, able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Why choose Premier Research?
Premier Research is more than a company – it’s a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need.
Our cultural anchors – Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team – mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location.
Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.
Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.

We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others.

Premier Research is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is compliant with all federal guidelines. All qualified applicants will receive equitable consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do
Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who You Are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Job Summary
We are seeking an ambitious Data Engineer to join our team. We have an Object-Oriented approach to data management, and it is key that you have experience in both object-oriented programming and data management (ETL, data warehousing). You will play a key role in developing and expanding Intrava’s data insights platform, report directly to the CTO, and work closely with product managers and dashboard developers. As the company grows you will have the opportunity to manage your own team of developers.
Who We Are
Intrava is a data insights platform solely focused on serving the real estate industry. Using state-of-the-art technologies, a unique approach to data management, and an innovative business model we help real estate companies make data-driven business decisions.
What you will be doing
Integrate customer data systems on our data insights platform, and work closely with dashboard developers and customers to transform and organize data for better insights.
At Intrava we believe it is important that you grow your skills in tandem with the job; hence, you will be given time to research your field, upskill, and experiment with new concepts and technologies.
Why work with us?
At Intrava you will be challenged and can expect to develop a diverse skillset. Not only will you play a key role in product implementation and development, but you’ll have an impact on business growth and maturity. You’ll work closely with the founders and learn from industry experts who have more than 20 years of IT experience from large publicly held organizations to small startups. If you are a creator at heart, and want to learn and work at a place where your contribution will have a great impact on product and company growth - Intrava is the right place.
We praise good work ethic and attention to detail (quality). This is a work environment for self-motivated people who set audacious goals and want to challenge themselves. Mistakes are welcome here; it is better to try and learn from your mistakes than to do nothing. We don’t believe in micro-management or narrow, overly specified job descriptions. We will provide guidance and training and expect you to prioritize and make your own decisions. As an early employee, we want you to add value beyond your job description. You need to be dynamic and ready to wear multiple hats.
As you continue to deliver good work and add value to the business you can expect a lot of flexibility and freedom when managing your time.
If you are intrigued by this job opportunity, we encourage you to apply, if you don’t know how you feel we discourage you from applying and suggest you find out what you aspire to first.
Job requirements
3+ years of Object-Oriented Programming (e.g., Java, C#, Ruby, PHP, Python, TS, etc.)
Strong interest in data management
Fluent in English with strong written and verbal communication skills
Preferred additional skills
1+ yrs. of data warehousing, data management, and analytics experience
1+ yrs. of experience with a data management tool (e.g., Informatica, Talend, SSIS, Alteryx, etc.)
Nice to have skills
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Sisense, PowerBI, Domo, Qlik, etc.)
AWS/MS Azure/Google Cloud experience
Knowledgeable in C++ or JavaScript
Compensation
Highly dependent on background and ability to learn and apply knowledge. You will be compensated with both a salary and stock options.

Summary

The primary responsibilities of the Clinical Research Associate is to conduct routine site monitoring visits and participate in site selection, site initiation and study closure activities. This role ensures that the clinical trial is being conducted according to the approved protocol, amendments and in compliance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP), Company SOPs, and all applicable regulatory requirements.

Responsibilities
Responsible for evaluation, initiation, monitoring, close-out and other tasks associated with the management of clinical sites. Ensure the conduct of all clinical studies is in accordance with Good Clinical Practices, International Harmonization Guideline, and appropriate Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).
Serve as primary contact for Clinical Research Organizations/ vendors, Investigators and study coordinators for study related questions.
In conjunction with study team, support feasibility and site selection process for clinical studies.
Supports country submissions and country requests as needed.
Assist and support development and review of clinical protocols, informed consent forms, or other study-related clinical documents (e.g. Case Report Forms, Source Documents, Monitoring Plan, Data Management Plan, Project Management Plan, etc.).
Manage patient recruitment strategies to increase patient randomization into the trial (eg investigator and research nurse meetings, update newsletters, advertising, targeted letters…).
Review all Adverse Events/Serious Adverse Events and ensure appropriate documentation is in place and any other safety issues are addressed and communicated.
Assist and support data validation and data cleaning procedures to ensure timelines are met.
Order and coordinate study supplies for clinical studies.
Develop and maintain tracking tools to support management of clinical studies.
Plan and participate in Investigator meetings and Clinical Research Associate trainings.

Requirements
Position requires Bachelor or nurse degree, preferably in the Life Sciences.
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical / biotechnology industry or CRO as a Clinical Research Associate from study start-up to database lock.
Strong Oncology monitoring experience in phase 1-3 pharmaceutical/ biotechnology clinical trials.
Possess good understanding of ICH guidelines, Good Clinical Practices (GCP), PhRMA code, FDA CFR, clinical research ethics, patient privacy laws, and other relevant, country regulatory requirements.
Good knowledge of concepts of clinical research and drug development.
Strong working knowledge of Electronic Data Capture, Interactive Voice/Web Response System and Clinical Trial Management System.
Ability to handle and prioritize multiple studies and projects.
Ability to work effectively in a team/matrix environment.
Ability to understand technical, scientific and medical information.
Demonstrated strengths in planning, organizational, project management, analytical skills, oral and written communication, time management, conflict management, problem solving, attention to detail, and interpersonal skills.
Fluent in English, oral and written.
Ability to travel 50% of working time or more.
Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications. Management reserves the right to change or modify such duties as required.

We Respect Your Privacy

The Incyte hiring organization processes your personal data to manage your job application in order to enter into an employment relationship with you if you are the successful candidate.

During the process, you may be asked to respond to questions that will screen out your application if you do not meet certain objective criteria required by the job. You can learn more about this process here.

You may have the right to access, delete, restrict, edit, move, or object to the use of your personal data. You may also have a right to report concerns to the authority responsible for data privacy in the country where the position is based or where you live or work.

By accessing this link you can learn about the types of personal data we collect, how we use it, whether collection and processing is optional, sources of the personal data we process, how it is shared, where it is stored or transferred to, how long we keep it, and contact information for Incyte, Incyte’s data protection officer, and your supervisory authority (if applicable).

Please contact privacy@incyte.com if you have any questions or concerns or would like to exercise your rights.

Description

Guardian Industries, a global company headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, employs more than 17,000 people and operates facilities throughout North America, Europe, South America, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Guardian’s diverse group of companies are involved in the manufacture of high-performance float, coated and fabricated glass products and the manufacture of high-quality chrome-plated and painted plastic components for the automotive and commercial truck industries. Guardian’s vision is to create value for customers and society through constant innovation using fewer resources. Guardian is a wholly owned subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.

Guardian is looking for a Data Engineer (remote work) based in Spain or Poland.

Data Engineer is the subject matter expert on dimensional modeling techniques and data integration from external partners into transactional systems and through to the data warehousing and analytical platforms. The individual must be able to communicate in written form and manage workload dependencies. Strong analytical and problem solving skills are required.

What You Will Do In Your Role

Participate in analysis sessions to understand functional and non-functional requirements
Design DW tables base on dimensional modeling techniques (Kimball)
Create/develop code and jobs in Talend while following enterprise best practices
Provide technical insight and develop work estimates to project planners
Should be responsible for building extraction and mapping rules for loading data from multiple sources for data warehouse implementation based on AWS Snowflake
Must have strong knowledge on Data Warehousing (DWH) concepts, ETL concepts, data analysis capabilities and experience in the Talend Big-Data Real Time ETL tool.
Work with business users to translate requirements into system flows, data flows, data mappings etc., and develop solutions to complex business problems
Maintain workload and time tracking within Azure DevOps
Development experience working in Agile Scrum environment

The Experience You Will Bring

Requirements

Experience as a Data engineer with strong data architecture knowledge around data warehousing concepts, SQL development and optimization, and operational support models
Must have experience with Talend Big-Data Real Time Studio.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment that requires quick turnaround and quality output.
Experience with Azure DevOps
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision

Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition, and maintenance of the central database and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front end.

Responsibilities:
Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers
Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules
Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges
Integration of data storage solutions
Team-leading abilities and mentoring

Skills And Qualifications:

Strong knowledge of PHP8, MySQL, OOP and Doctrine
Experience with/or technical understanding of Microservices Architecture
Understanding of MVC design patterns
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
Understanding accessibility and security compliance
Experience with Symfony will be considered an advantage
Experience with Big Data Systems will be considered an advantage

Quality Assurance Analyst

Job Description

Showoff is looking for an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst to join our remote working team. As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for working with our development and design team to iteratively test software applications, work with our clients to manage user acceptance testing, and advocate and implement new processes and frameworks for ensuring quality across our client applications. You will be actively involved through the project lifecycle and work closely with our Delivery team. This position is based in Ireland, working remotely with responsibilities to US-based clients.

Responsibilities

Creating and implementing test plans and test scenarios based on business and technical requirements
Perform functional testing for the user stories and manage feedback and bug tracking in Jira
Facilitate user acceptance testing and show the developed work in client-facing sprint reviews
Collaborate with development and design throughout the software development lifecycle

Qualifications

Proven work experience as a QA engineer or software tester
In-depth knowledge of the software development lifecycle and agile methodologies
Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Good understanding of native mobile testing, design best practices, and different tooling for testing. Automation experience is a plus.
Desire to work as a team player within an agile software development team and the ability to elicit feedback early in the testing process
Strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders and be in a client-facing role
The ability to prioritize work and manage time effectively
Fluent in spoken and written English

Preferred Experience / Skills

Experience in Atlassian tools (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence)
Experience creating and managing test suites for regression and smoke testing
Experience with Postman

Benefits at Showoff

Fully Remote Position with quarterly team in-person meetups
Competitive Salary
Home office set up support
Health Insurance
Life Assurance (Death in service)
Income Protection (Long term illness cover)
Irish Employment Permit (If required)
Mobile Phone Call Package (SIM)
Employee Assistance Programme
Wellbeing Platform
Paid Maternity and Paternity leave
20 days holidays plus 10 public holidays per year
Flexible working hours may be available upon request

About Showoff

Showoff has grown from 80 sheep and €4000 to where we are today, an Enterprise Consulting Partner (ECP). We provide an in-house team designed to help from concept to build and provide ongoing support after the work has been done. Our goal is to create lifelong features for our client's business that will give customers a unique, standalone experience, while simultaneously building a platform that will help their company run more efficiently and effectively.

What we do:
We provide an 'art of the possible' around our clients' digital plans and accelerate them above the rest in the ever-growing technological world. Guiding clients to build unique and innovative features that:

Increase customer engagement
Design new revenue streams suited for every customer situation.
Decrease company time - Seamless connectivity and improved workflow will increase company efficiency and reduce operational costs.
Open the floor to new projects and innovation
From start to finish, our team help companies accelerate their projects significantly faster than other traditional methods.

Why clients choose Showoff:

Showoff has reached the level of success today by focusing on three main priorities for each opportunity that arises:

Adapt - Understand a company’s industry, the need to change and the most efficient way to facilitate their transformation.
React - Create a structured plan that increases the efficiency of your project and time to completion at every step of the way.
Support - Provide support to ensure consistency and reduce any risk to scaling a business.

At Showoff you will get the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment with exposure to an exciting variety of projects and industries. Our hardworking team are passionate about technology and expanding their knowledge and skills. We’re proud to have an inclusive, diverse and driven team that supports each other to be the best that they can be, delivering consistently top-class products and services to our clients.

How to apply:

To apply, send us:
An up-to-date CV
Cover letter
Examples of your work / Portfolio
If you think you are the right person for the job, and for immediate consideration please get in touch with jobs@showoff.ie, making reference to the Quality Assurance Analyst position.

Please note:
Should you choose to apply for our position, we will contact you to inform you of our recruitment process. If you would like your application to be kept on file for any future potential opportunities, please let us know in your reply.

Showoff is fully compliant with GDPR regulations and you can read more about our privacy policy here: https://bit.ly/ShowoffPolicies. Your shared data will not be disclosed or transferred to a third-party data controller or data processor located outside the EEA unless we have obtained your express consent. We look forward to working with you.

Persönliche Entfaltung in der BI Welt von morgen!

Unserem Leitspruch «experience the sense of tomorrow» verpflichtet unterstützen wir zukunftsorientierte Kunden dabei, aus der Vielzahl ihrer Daten businessrelevante Informationen zu visualisieren und zuverlässige Unternehmenssteuerung in ein erfolgreiches Morgen zu ermöglichen. Wir bieten Dir eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem professionellen und marketingorientierten Unternehmen an, welches die Digitalisierung vorantreibt und Dir die optimale Basis für eine zukunftsorientierte Entwicklung im Consulting ermöglicht. Bei uns kannst du visionär mitgestalten mit viel Eigenverantwortung in einem motivierenden und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsumfeld. Du arbeitest in abwechslungsreichen Business Intelligence Projekten bei namhaften Kunden in verschiedensten Branchen. Deine Begeisterung für Daten, Selbständigkeit und Berufsstolz sind bereits gute Voraussetzungen, um mit uns ins Gespräch zu kommen.

Innerhalb unserer Wachstumsstrategie suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine hochmotivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit für unseren Standort in Deutschland. Der Arbeitsort ist flexibel und grösstenteils arbeiten wir in Deutschland remote, es sollte aber eine gewisse Reisebereitschaft vorhanden sein.

Deine Aufgaben

Beratung von Kunden in vielfältigen BI-Themen im Zusammenspiel mit verschiedenen Quell- und Umsystemen
Unterstützung unseres Sales Teams bei der Gewinnung von Neukunden und dem nachhaltigen Ausbau unseres Kundenstamms
Mit Deinem koordinierten Vorgehen ermittelst Du den Informationsbedarf aus der Sicht unserer Kunden und bist entweder verantwortlich für die Beratung, Konzeptionierung, Planung, Entwicklung sowie der nachhaltigen Betreuung von BI- und Datawarehouse Lösungen auf der Basis von Microsoft Power Plattform und Data Integration (SQL-Server, Synapse, SSIS etc.) on Premises, Azure oder in HybridClouds oder von BI-Lösungen auf der Basis von Qlik und Jedox
Selbständige Durchführung von Projekten und Koordination mit dem Kunden

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung im Datawarehouse- und BI-Umfeld mit Microsoft Produkten insbesondere Power-BI und Synapse oder Erfahrung mit Qlik
Du verstehst Daten und sprichst SQL
Vorkenntnisse im Bereich SAP BI, SAP BW etc. sind ein Plus
Du hast eine hohe Kundenorientierung, gehst Herausforderungen gezielt an und es macht Dir Spass Projekte lösungs- und budgetorientiert mit und für Kunden umzusetzen
Du fühlst Dich wohl dabei, eine hohe Kommunikationskultur innerhalb von Projekten und Kundenbeziehungen zu etablieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland und der Schweiz

Unser Angebot
Eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem spannenden, modernen Spielfeld und einem starken, erfahrenen Team. Es erwarten Dich ein moderner Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, spannende und herausfordernde Projekte. Bei uns kannst Du etwas bewegen!

Bist Du unsere Verstärkung? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen.

We work with innovative start-ups and projects across the globe from as far as South East Asia and up to North America. As our clients are expanding, so are we. If you’re up for a dynamic environment and are not afraid to problem solve on a daily basis - Noborders will be the ideal workplace for you to polish existing skills, acquire new knowledge, give a chance for those brain juices to flow and really feel the impact your efforts make on a business.

What’s gonna be your day to day, week on week

Day starts with checking in to see how our clients closed their business day. We thrive for success. This would include, Google Analytics, Google Ads, Bing Ads, Facebook Ads and more.
Taking note of the development and progress of your accounts you will make the necessary optimizations to client campaigns if necessary. This requires working with audiences, bids, targeting and automating where necessary.
Update daily performance reports and prepare weekly overviews detailing the work carried out and progress made. Take the time to dive into the data and understand not just the numbers, but the story behind them.
Check on your clients properties, either app or web, making sure there is no obvious friction in the funnel and tracking is working as it should be.
Maintain a strong grasp over the market dynamics and competitor activities. Strive to be ahead of the train, not in the last wagon.
We cannot replace a marketing department, but we do our best to let our clients know we work for them. Be ready to take part in active client discussions and workspaces.

What would it take to be successful in your role

Definitely - At least 4 years of Search Engine and Display Advertising experience (working with App campaigns a big bonus).
Definitely - At least 2 years of experience running Social Media Ads.
Definitely - Have experience managing accounts spending in excess of 10,000EUR per month.
Definitely - Can set-up web and performance tracking.
Definitely - Fluent with Google Analytics and/or other similar web analytics tools.
Probably - Strong knowledge of Google Tag Manager and Data studio / Looker studio.
Maybe - Have basic understanding of HTML, code debugging and SQL.
Love to think logically and problem solve. Are able to quickly shift focus to meet client requirements.
Be proactive, take initiative and self-motivated.
Fluent English and Latvian. Russian would be a strong advantage.
Brownie points if you have worked with Financial services, Travel or B2B sector projects.

What can you expect

Salary between 2,000 - 3,000 EUR gross based on experience.
Remote work.
Working with a young and ambitious team.
Professional growth opportunities.
Yearly performance bonuses.

Verde Energy Group are a leading Irish owned and operated Energy Services company providing a range of Capex and financed energy saving solutions to clients. We pride ourselves in delivering industry leading knowledge and market leading professional project delivery with a client first approach.
We are now recruiting for an experienced Project Manager as a new addition to the Project Management Team in Ireland.

Key responsibilities and Objectives of this role:
· The Project Manager is responsible for delivering energy efficient & renewable solutions that meet customer's requirement and expectation.
· Manage and/or complete a comprehensive survey of customer’s facility in compliance with project scope.
· Manage all aspects from customer contract to completion & Execute project planning, budgeting, scheduling, and implementation in accordance with Customer requirements and approved processes and procedures.
· Supporting the Sales Team in presenting technological capabilities.
· Select and sub-contract the electrical works to an approved installation contractor, verifying/approving change orders, daily review with Operations Team on project status, verification of completion of all milestones in the project installation, success in completing each project on time, on budget, in compliance with project scope and to the Customer’s satisfaction.
· To liaise with Supply Chain Manager and ensure on time delivery of products to customers and/or authorised contractors for installation as scheduled.
· Investigating problems and handling queries from customer that may arise from time to time during different stages of project.
· Manage installation projects. Complete project assessments and proposal development consultation with Project Engineering Team and Operations Team.
· Coordinate and lead final walkthrough to obtain customer acceptance and sign-off at completion.
· Completing Health and Safety packs prior to Project Commencement
· Formulation of Operation and Maintenance manuals for the client

· Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
· Be highly organised and detail oriented.

· Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and can develop innovative and practical solutions to technical problems.
· Good at building rapport with customers to achieve a closer working relationship.
· Are cost-conscious and have a meticulous approach to quality.

Benefits

Description

Perceptyx is the most comprehensive listening solution platform available in the HR Tech world today. It illuminates the employee experience for millions of people globally. Our work helps whole organizations thrive (enterprise level to an organization with 5,000 employees).

We are looking for a new team member to join our Platform Services Professionals in Poland (you must be based in Poland). This role will be executing daily tasks to build, configure, and update employee surveys using an internal shared task list. Work will be on the front end of our platform and products.🙌 😊.

We don't like micromanagement and are looking for a professional who will be in charge of their own daily tasks and will deliver high-quality results on time. Our next colleague will have a passion for data and will be interested to grow together with us! We have a great internal career path for like-minded professionals. Remote work is preferred, however, we do have an office for networking in Wroclaw.

Our Platform Services Specialist will:

Receive tasks from the Customer Solutions team aimed at loading, updating, and personalizing the platform for customers
Focus on front-end configurations (toolkit builds, English email setup, dashboards, etc.)
Work closely with other team members
Successfully complete configuration tasks across Perceptyx products to solve the customers’ business problems. This is not a client-facing role but will involve completing work for our clients
Support Perceptyx internal Customer Solutions Partners, Implementation Experts, and Customer Care Coordinators
Follow procedures based on best practices for the daily customer tasks
Present task completion reports to the Manager, Platform Services bi-weekly to be used at the internal sync ups

Requirements

We would like you to have:

Minimum 1 year of relevant experience with strong technical, data, and configuration skills in data management or configurations
Passion for technical data and interest to grow in tech and data-related industry
Understanding of HTML, SQL, CSS, Excel, and grep
Explicit attention to detail, ability to pick up new systems and processes quickly, and ability to navigate tasks and technical work quickly
Good time management, organization, and personal effectiveness skills
Good written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of an organization
Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Good written and spoken English skills to communicate with international teams

We would like you to be:

Quick learner, self-starter, able to work efficiently with minimal supervision
Confident, ready for a challenge, and be not afraid of sking questions. This position is a great learning opportunity
Comfortable with using new systems and technology, specifically in web-based systems
Adaptable to change within the process, workflow, or systems
Willing to work with people from diverse backgrounds and experiences

Benefits

Working remotely from home (based in Poland) with the possibility to network in person with our other team members in Wrocław, Poland, and remotely with your manager in the USA and the team in Europe
Premium healthcare package
Fitness reimbursement programme and internal wellness initiatives
Opportunities to grow with like-minded professionals in a truly international tech environment. We offer continuous learning and development in interesting projects (people analytics, employee survey, and customer service) while providing you guidance and support throughout your journey with us
You are in charge of your daily work. We provide the tools and training- you make a meaningful impact, your way
A diverse and inclusive culture. You will be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others

Perceptyx is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Key Responsibilities
Performing 1st and 2nd line Technical & Operational Support for Datacentre and Hybrid Cloud customers
Performing all the functions of the 'Customer Helpdesk' role working in shifts (24/7) and additionally providing in-depth technical support to customers through network using service/device monitoring and remote repair.

Providing process improvement input wherever possible
Performing system monitoring, proactive incident management
Providing proactive jeopardy management
Soft Skills

Focusing on the objectives and the required outcomes of the processes while delivering a service
Working with a cooperative and positive attitude in a group setting to achieve common goals
Communicating effectively and efficiently while adapting to your audience and getting the message through as intended
Taking the responsibility and taking care of the consequences of making a decision

Technical Skills

Advantageous - Understanding of Data centre and Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure)
